newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel denies Dresdner interested in Postbank.
newsitem.headline: Waigel denies Dresdner interested in Postbank.

text.p: REGENSBURG, Germany, May 23 (Reuter) German Finance Minister Theo Waigel on Thursday denied media reports that Dresdner Bank was interested in taking a stake in Postbank, the postal bank expected to be privatised soon.

Waigel added that the source of the reports, which cited working papers from the London investment bank Schroders indicating Dresdner might be interested, was not a basis on which any finance ministry decision would be based.
The minister was speaking at the start of a meeting of German Austrian and Swiss finance ministers.
Waigel stressed, however, that the government was eager to push through Postbank's privatisation this year.
Dresdner Bank itself earlier also denied the reports.
